alert.note: Alert for Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 7:12PM EDT until May 03 at 1:41PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warnings continues for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Kennebec and Sagadahoc Counties. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Kennebec and Somerset Counties. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Moderate flooding is Forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Kennebec River at North Sidney. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 21.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 PM EDT Tuesday was 24.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 13.7 feet early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
